prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to continue this text. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story:
The Eurovision Song Contest is just around the corner and this year, it's taking place in Malmo, Sweden.

You can find out all about the event right here.

The UK's entry for 2024 is Olly Alexander who'll be performing his song, Dizzy.

But how's he feeling ahead of the big night, where he'll perform in front of 200 million people!

De-Graft sat down with him to find out all about his preparation for the competition.

The Eurovision Song contest Grand Final will be shown on BBC One and iPlayer on Saturday 11 May.
stories:
The Eurovision Song Contest is just around the corner and this year, it's taking place in Malmo, Sweden.

You can find out all about the event right here.

The UK's entry for 2024 is Olly Alexander who'll be performing his song, Dizzy.

But how's he feeling ahead of the big night, where he'll perform in front of 200 million people!

De-Graft sat down with him to find out all about his preparation for the competition.

The Eurovision Song contest Grand Final will be shown on BBC One and iPlayer on Saturday 11 May.

Olly Alexander is feeling a mix of excitement and nerves as he prepares to take to the stage for the Eurovision Song Contest.

"I'm just trying to enjoy the moment," he said. "I'm so grateful to be here and I'm just going to give it my all."

He added that he was looking forward to performing in front of such a large audience.

"It's going to be amazing to perform in front of so many people," he said. "I can't wait to share my music with them."

When asked what he thought of his chances of winning, Olly Alexander was cautiously optimistic.

"I think I have a good shot," he said. "I'm just going to focus on giving my best performance and see what happens."

Eurovision fans can tune in to watch Olly Alexander perform on Saturday 11 May at 8pm BST on BBC One and iPlayer.

Olly Alexander is feeling a mix of excitement and nerves as he prepares to take to the stage for the Eurovision Song Contest.

"I'm just trying to enjoy the moment," he said. "I'm so grateful to be here and I'm just going to give it my all."

"It's going to be amazing to perform in front of so many people," he said. "I can't wait to share my music with them."

When asked what he thought of his chances of winning, Olly Alexander was cautiously optimistic.

"I think I have a good shot," he said. "I'm just going to focus on giving my best performance and see what happens."
